sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Barrett Business Services Q4 2025 Earnings Report & Stock Performance - News and Statistics
feed.summary: Barrett Business Services Inc. reported its Q4 2025 earnings, with net income meeting Wall Street's expectations at 64 cents per share. However, the company's adjusted revenue of $2.4 billion missed forecasts, which had anticipated $2.42 billion. For the full year, Barrett Business Services reported a profit of $54.4 million on revenue of $9.04 billion, with its share price declining by 13% since the start of the year and 22% over the last 12 months.

feed.title: EHealth, Inc. (EHTH): Analyst Rating Holds Steady Amidst Price Drop
feed.summary: Analyst George Sutton from Craig-Hallum maintained a "Hold" rating for eHealth, Inc. (EHTH) with a $2 price target, despite the company's recent stock price plummet of nearly 30% and disappointing Q4 2025 earnings. The stock exhibits high volatility and negative short- and long-term performance, suggesting a cautious approach for investors. The consensus view, with no "Buy" or "Sell" ratings, indicates limited optimism for swift recovery and points towards stabilization at current depressed levels.

feed.title: Is Truist Financial’s (TFC) M&A Hire and Bitcoin ETF Push Reframing Its Strategic Identity?
feed.summary: Truist Financial (TFC) recently appointed a new head of M&A, announced a significant debt redemption, and expanded its wealth offering to include spot Bitcoin ETFs. These actions indicate an effort to enhance advisory capabilities, optimize its balance sheet, and cautiously integrate digital assets. While these moves refine its strategic identity, the bank still faces challenges related to commercial real estate exposure and branch network costs, with its capital management decisions and market sentiment around these factors being crucial for its future performance.

feed.title: Inside the Arkansas plant building 115,000 rocket motors a year for L3Harris
feed.summary: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth visited L3Harris Technologies' Camden, Arkansas site as part of his "Arsenal of Freedom" tour, emphasizing the critical role of American manufacturing in national defense. L3Harris is significantly expanding its solid rocket motor production capabilities, including new facilities, to meet the increasing demand for missile programs. The company plans to pursue an initial public offering for its solid rocket motor business in the second half of the year.

feed.title: GE Aerospace Expansion And Defense Push Test Premium Valuation
feed.summary: GE Aerospace is investing over $1 billion to expand its global engine Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul network, alongside deepening defense partnerships and supporting next-generation propulsion technologies. This strategic expansion aims to reinforce its position in both commercial and military engines, but investors will be monitoring execution, contract milestones, and demand shifts, especially given the stock's current valuation. The company's shares are trading at a significant premium to Simply Wall St's estimated fair value, making execution critical to sentiment.

feed.title: Sempra (SRE) Margin Drop To 13.2% Tests Bullish Growth And Valuation Narratives
feed.summary: Sempra (SRE) recently reported FY 2025 Q4 results with trailing net profit margin dropping to 13.2% from 21.4% a year ago, sparking concerns among investors despite a DCF fair value significantly higher than its current share price. Bears highlight increased operating and financing costs from large capital programs and regulatory risks, while bulls point to expected earnings and revenue growth driven by Texas growth and new LNG projects. The company's high P/E ratio, coupled with weaker dividend and interest coverage, creates tension for investors trying to reconcile optimistic growth projections with current financial performance.

feed.title: Teledyne Technologies Modifies SOFR Terms on Credit Facility
feed.summary: Teledyne Technologies (TDY) has amended its credit facility to remove the 0.10% Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR) adjustment, simplifying its rate structure and potentially reducing future interest expenses on floating-rate borrowings. This change, effective February 25, 2026, reflects an evolution in how corporate credit agreements reference benchmark interest rates. TipRanks' AI Analyst "Spark" rates TDY as an Outperform, citing strong financial performance and positive earnings call momentum, despite a relatively high P/E valuation without dividends.

feed.title: Cisco President Says AI Agents Need To Get The Background Checks Done — Yet Predicts 6 Products 'Written With AI Only' By The End Of 2026
feed.summary: Cisco Systems Inc. President and Chief Product Officer Jeetu Patel revealed that the company already has one product built entirely with AI-generated code and expects to have six such products by the end of 2026. Patel emphasized that while AI agents can significantly boost productivity, they require safety and security checks similar to human employees. He also highlighted Cisco's "full stack" approach to AI infrastructure and the transformative potential of AI to generate original insights beyond human knowledge.

feed.title: S&P 500’s Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK) VP Sells Shares
feed.summary: A Vice President at Rockwell Automation (NYSE:ROK), an S&P 500 company, has sold shares. The article notes that Rockwell Automation specializes in industrial automation and digital transformation, providing products like programmable controllers and automation software. Full details require logging in or creating an account on Kalkine Media.

feed.title: ROSEN, GLOBALLY RESPECTED INVESTOR COUNSEL, Encourages Ramaco Resources, Inc. Investors to ...
feed.summary: The Rosen Law Firm is encouraging investors who purchased Ramaco Resources, Inc. (METC) securities between July 31, 2023, and October 23, 2023, to join a class action lawsuit. The deadline to serve as lead plaintiff is March 31, 2026. The lawsuit alleges that Ramaco made materially false and misleading statements regarding the development progress at its Brook Mine.

feed.title: Lockheed Martin Sees Unusually Large Options Volume (NYSE:LMT)
feed.summary: Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) experienced unusually high call option volume, with investors buying 155,267 call options, indicating a strongly bullish sentiment that coincided with a rise in its stock price to $659.24. This activity follows mixed Q4 earnings where Lockheed missed EPS but beat revenue estimates, while institutional investors increased their stakes. Analysts maintain a "Hold" rating with a consensus target of $612.50 despite several price target upgrades.

feed.title: Investors Purchase Large Volume of Call Options on The Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS)
feed.summary: Investors recently purchased a significantly higher volume of call options on The Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS), marking a 284% increase over the daily average, which suggests a bullish sentiment or options-driven activity. Despite this, insiders have been significant sellers of GS stock, divesting over $112 million in shares in the last 90 days. Goldman Sachs also beat Q4 EPS estimates and raised its dividend, yet the stock saw a decline, and analysts maintain a consensus "Hold" rating with a target price of $916.86.

feed.title: Quaker Houghton declares $0.508 quarterly dividend
feed.summary: Quaker Houghton (NYSE:KWR) announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.508 per share, payable on April 30, 2026, to shareholders of record as of April 16, 2026. This comes after Quaker Chemical Corporation reported a Q4 EPS miss but exceeded revenue expectations, leading Jefferies to raise its price target to $203 with a Buy rating. The content is AI-generated and editor-reviewed.

feed.title: CBRE (NYSE: CBRE) CEO Jamie Hodari receives 10,583-share 2026 equity grant
feed.summary: CBRE CEO Jamie Hodari has been granted 10,583 shares of Class A common stock as part of his 2026 annual equity award, increasing his direct holdings to 43,436 shares. The award, detailed in an SEC Form 4 filing, was granted at no purchase price and will vest in four equal 25% installments on February 25, 2027, 2028, 2029, and 2030, subject to specific conditions. This transaction is classified as an acquisition via grant, not an open-market purchase, and is subject to potential forfeiture or acceleration as outlined in the award agreement.

feed.title: Honeywell (HON) Upgraded by Wolfe Research, Shares Rise
feed.summary: Honeywell's shares rose by 1.6% after Wolfe Research upgraded its rating to Outperform and increased its price target, citing the upcoming aerospace business separation as a catalyst. Analyst Nigel Coe highlighted the potential monetization of Honeywell's Quantinuum investment and its pension surplus, which could further boost shareholder value. Despite strong operational metrics, the company's premium valuation and a higher reliance on debt financing warrant investor vigilance.

feed.title: Cognizant (CTSH) awards RSUs and PSUs to CLO and CAO Kim
feed.summary: Cognizant Technology Solutions (CTSH) has granted restricted stock units (RSUs) and performance stock units (PSUs) to its Chief Legal Officer, Chief Accounting Officer, and Corporate Secretary, John Sunshin Kim. The grants include 26,903 RSUs and an additional 3,261 RSUs, both with staggered vesting schedules extending until March 2029. Kim also received 10,972 PSUs from a previous award, which are scheduled to vest in March 2026 following the satisfaction of 57% of performance criteria.

feed.title: Equity award lifts CBRE (NYSE: CBRE) director stake to 41,927
feed.summary: CBRE Group director Vincent Clancy received an equity award of 6,791 shares of Class A common stock at no cost. This grant, made in his capacity as CEO and Chair of Turner & Townsend, increases his direct stake to 41,927 shares. The shares will vest in four equal 25% installments annually from 2027 to 2030, aligning his compensation with long-term share performance.

feed.title: Earl Congdon Sells 25,000 Shares of Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL) Stock
feed.summary: Earl Congdon, an insider at Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL), sold 25,000 shares of the company's stock for approximately $4.90 million, reducing his stake by 1.14%. The sale occurred after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings and increased its quarterly dividend. ODFL's stock price rose by 2.4% following the earnings beat.

feed.title: Stanley Bergman Sells 10,785 Shares of Henry Schein (NASDAQ:HSIC) Stock
feed.summary: Stanley Bergman, CEO of Henry Schein (NASDAQ:HSIC), sold 10,785 shares of the company's stock for approximately $875,742 on February 27th, reducing his stake by 3.37%. The company recently beat quarterly earnings estimates and provided optimistic FY2026 guidance. Analysts currently rate Henry Schein as a "Hold" with a consensus target price of $85.58.

feed.title: Generac (NYSE:GNRC) CFO Sells $5,739,930.82 in Stock
feed.summary: Generac Holdings Inc. CFO York Ragen sold 24,362 shares of the company's stock for over $5.7 million on February 25th, reducing his stake by 15.08%. This comes after Generac missed quarterly earnings expectations and saw its stock dip. Analysts currently have a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average price target of $220.19 for GNRC.

feed.title: Ellen Patterson Sells 60,000 Shares of Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) Stock
feed.summary: Ellen Patterson, EVP at Wells Fargo & Company, sold 60,000 shares of WFC stock for over $5.24 million, reducing her stake by approximately 26%. This insider sale, coupled with another by EVP Bridget Engle, contributed to a nearly 6% drop in Wells Fargo's stock price amid broader financial sector weakness and rate-cut uncertainties. Despite beating EPS estimates in its latest earnings report, the company's revenue slightly missed expectations, and analysts currently rate WFC as a "Moderate Buy" with an average target price of $97.03.

feed.title: Insider Selling: Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) Director Sells 170,105 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) Director Arne Alexander Wilhelmsen sold 170,105 shares of the company's stock on February 25th, valued at over $53.7 million. This sale was part of a larger series of transactions in February where Wilhelmsen sold a total of 771,607 shares for approximately $243.6 million, though he still retains a significant stake valued at roughly $5.38 billion. The article also touches on recent corporate actions by Royal Caribbean, including a $2.0 billion stock buyback authorization, an increased quarterly dividend, and generally positive analyst ratings despite the insider selling.

feed.title: CBRE (CBRE) CFO Giamartino sells stock, receives 10,900-share 2026 award
feed.summary: Emma E. Giamartino, CFO and Chief Investment Officer of CBRE Group, reported an open-market sale of 9,223 Class A Common Stock shares at $148.61 each. Concurrently, she received a 2026 annual equity award of 10,900 shares, which will vest 25% annually from February 25, 2027, to 2030. Additionally, 943 shares were disposed of at $147.24 to cover tax obligations related to the equity award.

feed.title: Motorola Solutions (NYSE:MSI) CEO Sells 7,000 Shares

Horn, was granted 1,867 shares of Class A common stock as part of his 2026 annual equity award, with a vesting schedule of 25% per year over four years. feed.title: George Mrkonic Jr Sells 336 Shares of AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) Stock
feed.summary: AutoZone Director George Mrkonic Jr. sold 336 shares of the company's stock on December 31st for over $1 million, reducing his stake by 9.43%. Analysts have subsequently lowered price targets, with the stock currently trading around $3,751.68.

feed.title: Insider Selling: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) Director Sells 2,500 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: Applied Materials director Judy Bruner sold 2,500 shares of the company's stock for $979,275 on February 25th, following an earlier sale of 3,969 shares on February 23rd. These transactions decreased her ownership by 8.74%. The sales occurred amidst solid quarterly results from Applied Materials, which beat EPS expectations and provided strong Q2 2026 guidance, alongside generally positive analyst sentiment.

feed.title: Causeway International Value Exits iShares MSCI EAFE ETF, Impacting Portfolio by -2.62%
feed.summary: Causeway International Value (Trades, Portfolio) fund's Q4 2025 N-PORT filing reveals significant portfolio changes, including the complete exit from the iShares MSCI EAFE ETF (EFA), which had a -2.62% impact, and GSK PLC, with a -1.86% impact. The fund also made new investments in KDDI Corp, PT Bank Mandiri, and Daimler Truck Holding AG, while increasing stakes in Diageo PLC and SMC Corp. The diversified portfolio, managed with a value-driven approach, is concentrated across 11 industries, primarily in developed countries outside the U.S.

feed.title: [Form 4] COGNIZANT TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS CORP Insider Trading Activity
feed.summary: This Form 4 filing details insider trading activity at Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp (CTSH) by Chief People Officer Kathryn Diaz. The report indicates she received 11,821 restricted stock units (RSUs) and an additional 3,261 RSUs on February 25, 2026, both with staggered vesting schedules extending to March 1, 2029. Furthermore, 2,743 and 1,070 performance stock units (PSUs) from prior grants were also reported, with vesting set for March 15, 2026, following the satisfaction of approximately 57% of performance criteria.

feed.title: Cognizant (CTSH) CFO receives new RSU grants and PSUs
feed.summary: Cognizant Technology Solutions' CFO, Jatin P. Dalal, has been granted new equity awards, including 35,463 restricted stock units (RSUs) and 12,228 RSUs, both vesting in quarterly installments through March 2029 under the company's 2023 Incentive Award Plan. Additionally, the Compensation and Human Capital Committee determined that approximately 121% of the performance criteria were achieved for previously granted performance stock units (PSUs) from February 2024, which are now scheduled to vest and settle in Class A common stock on March 15, 2026, contingent on Dalal's continued service. These transactions were reported in a Form 4 SEC filing.

feed.title: Planet Fitness, Dill Dinkers, Urban Air To Join Tractor Supply In Former Edgewater Kmart Redevelopment
feed.summary: The former Kmart building in Edgewater, Maryland, is being redeveloped into a new community hub for fitness and recreation. Planet Fitness, Dill Dinkers, and Urban Air are set to join the already open Tractor Supply Co. in the 117,000-square-foot space. This redevelopment aims to transform the long-vacant property into an all-in-one destination for workouts, indoor sports, and family activities, bringing new life and traffic to Solomons Island Road.

feed.title: Garmin (NASDAQ: GRMN) VP Susan Lyman sells 3,805 registered shares
feed.summary: Garmin's VP of Consumer Sales & Marketing, Susan Lyman, sold 3,805 registered shares of Garmin stock through two open-market transactions on February 26, 2026, at weighted average prices of $251.0425 and $252.0936. This follows the vesting of 3,287 restricted stock units on February 25, 2026, with 988 shares withheld for tax liabilities. After these transactions, Lyman directly holds 7,471 shares and has indirect holdings and unvested units.

feed.title: Garmin (GRMN) aviation EVP has shares withheld to cover RSU tax bill
feed.summary: Garmin Ltd.'s EVP and Managing Director of Aviation, Philip Straub, had 4,234 registered shares withheld on February 25, 2026, to cover a tax liability from vested restricted stock units. This transaction occurred at a value of $251.99 per share and was not an open-market sale. Following this, Straub directly holds 101,558.5 shares, including 17,751 unvested shares.

feed.title: Crown Castle (CCI) EVP & CHRO awarded 8,632 Time RSUs under incentive plan
feed.summary: Crown Castle Inc.'s EVP & CHRO, Timothy P. Grace, was granted 8,632 Time Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) on February 25, 2026, as part of the company’s 2022 Long-Term Incentive Plan. These RSUs, awarded at $0.00 per unit, entitle him to receive shares of common stock upon vesting. The vesting schedule includes three equal installments on February 19 of 2027, 2028, and 2029, contingent on continued service, aligning executive interests with shareholder value.

feed.title: Global Net Lease 2025 Financial Results: Q4 FFO $66.2M, Annual Revenue $495.3M - News and Statistics
feed.summary: Global Net Lease Inc. announced its Q4 2025 financial results, reporting funds from operations (FFO) of $66.2 million (29 cents per share) and revenue of $117 million. For the full year 2025, the company achieved FFO of $221 million and an annual revenue of $495.3 million. The real estate investment trust forecasts its full-year FFO for the upcoming period to be between 80 and 84 cents per share.

feed.title: What Insights Analyst Forecasts Provide on Genius Sports Limited (GENI) Q4 Performance Indicators
feed.summary: Analysts expect Genius Sports Limited (GENI) to report Q4 earnings of $0.02 per share, a 166.7% increase year-over-year, with revenue projected at $235.52 million, up 34.2%. The EPS consensus estimate was recently revised downward by 17.6%. While segment-specific revenue forecasts show strong growth in Betting Technology (27%) and Media Technology (82.9%), Sports Technology is anticipated to slightly decline.

feed.title: Banco Santander SA (ADR): Quiet Chart, Big Shifts Behind the Scenes for US Investors
feed.summary: Banco Santander's ADR appears stable, but underlying factors like European rate cuts, Latin American credit risk, and the bank's capital strategies are reshaping its long-term earnings trajectory for US investors. The article highlights how Santander provides global diversification but emphasizes that its performance is influenced by central bank policies, FX fluctuations, and emerging market risks, rather than solely by US financial dynamics. It suggests that while the bank trades at a discount compared to US peers, investors should consider its hybrid European-Latin American exposure, dividend potential, and sensitivity to macro events.

feed.title: KD Investors Have Opportunity to Lead Kyndryl Holdings, Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit Filed by The Rosen Law Firm
feed.summary: The Rosen Law Firm reminds purchasers of Kyndryl Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KD) securities that they have an opportunity to lead a securities fraud class action lawsuit. Investors who bought Kyndryl securities between August 7, 2024, and February 9, 2026, are encouraged to contact the firm by April 13, 2026, to join the lawsuit. The complaint alleges that Kyndryl made false or misleading statements regarding its financial statements, internal controls, and ability to file timely reports, leading to investor damages.

feed.title: Rosen Law Firm Encourages Hub Group, Inc. Investors to Inquire About Securities Class Action Investigation - HUBG
feed.summary: The Rosen Law Firm is investigating potential securities claims against Hub Group, Inc. on behalf of investors. This investigation follows Hub Group's announcement of an error in its 2025 financial statements, which led to an understatement of purchased transportation costs and accounts payable, causing a significant drop in its stock price. The firm is preparing a class action lawsuit to recover investor losses and encourages affected shareholders to contact them.

feed.title: Weekly Market Update: Stocks Edge Lower as Consumer Defensives Rise and Financial Services Fall
feed.summary: The Morningstar US Market Index fell 0.48% for the week ending Feb. 27, with consumer defensives and utilities outperforming, while financial services and technology lagged. Clarivate and Paramount were top stock gainers, experiencing significant percentage increases, while Shoals Technologies and Sunrun were among the biggest losers. The article also highlights key economic events and earnings reports scheduled for the upcoming week.

feed.title: LAKE Investors Have Opportunity to Lead Lakeland Industries, Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit
feed.summary: Rosen Law Firm has announced a class action lawsuit against Lakeland Industries, Inc. (NASDAQ: LAKE) on behalf of investors who purchased securities between December 1, 2023, and December 9, 2025. The lawsuit alleges that Lakeland made false and misleading statements regarding its business operations, financial results, and M&A strategy, leading to investor damages. Investors have until April 24, 2026, to move the Court to serve as lead plaintiff.

feed.title: Miluna Acquisition Appoints Independent Director Yajuan Ding
feed.summary: Miluna Acquisition Corp. (MMTX) has appointed Yajuan Ding as an independent director, replacing Mei Chi Tsai. Ding, an investment professional with extensive SPAC and private equity experience, received 10,000 sponsor shares as part of her compensation. Miluna Acquisition Corp. is a special purpose acquisition company focused on business combinations.

feed.title: Vahaviolos trust discloses 5.25M-share Mistras Group (MG) ownership on Form 3
feed.summary: A Form 3 filing reveals that the 2025 Irrevocable Two-Year Grantor Retained Annuity Trust of Aspasia F. Vahaviolos has disclosed an initial beneficial ownership of 5,251,358 shares of Mistras Group (MG) common stock. This makes the trust a more than 10% owner of the company. The filing serves as an initial reporting of existing holdings rather than a new transaction.
